So observations from first night of pre-con league. The curses don't discourage attacking like I had wondered, though they don't necessarily actively alter decision making process's, either. Curse of Get Me Free Zombies did work, but it was kind of accidental.

Mathas is hot, hot garbage, though. Granted removal is at a premium at this point in the league, but he altered nobodies decision making, and actively saved a Vampire Nighthawk I had out because with draw also at a premium the cat player with a Wing Clip didn't want to help everyone.
At least one other pod commented how he was wasn't just not useful but downright harmful to have as a commander.
Was this your first time playing against Mathas?
First time for real vs. theorycrafting, yep. And week one is out-of-box decks. Maybe making improvements from here on out will make people lose the ability to math.
Too early to call him hot garbage.
Actually maybe people will just learn to not cast him until it's 1v1
Play a few more games with him.
But at that point why not just run a commander who is good the entire game
I was using Edgar, but he's literally the first cut I'm making this week. As bad as he is as a general he's so much worse in the 99
Licia was a damn beast, though.
In a life gain deck she's gonna be fun
Really? Edgar was terribad?
Sorry, constructed that poorly. Mathas is the first cut
She was a big fat beat stick in Nate's build.
Ah
Licia with Blood Baron on the field was just gross
Dana are you going to put Cloudstone Curio in your 1-2 drop vamps deck?
Wow! Guys, this thing:
<http://www.izzetmtgnews.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/08/jp_xln_yjedfb9j5.jpg>
I probably asked that already I feel
It's a cavern of Souls without uncounterability on a rock.
And it doesn't ETB tapped
Yep, it's kind of a win-con in there, I can't add it probably week 3 though since we only have 10 dollars a week
I'm planning on taking my vamp precon down that route with Curio, Purohoros and cheap critters with cathar's crusade ironically
Yeah, that will be the best build I think. I think a lot of people are going to run good vampires and be disapointed.
Same
Doesn't etb tapped is really nice on that rock
What draw engines are you playing on putting in there?
I'm working on my Edgar to be aristocrat-ish.
None of the "draw x lose x life" spells are ever appealing to me
Haven't entirely decided, but this week I'm adding all the 1-2 drops except Bloodgast, and another 5-6 small draw spells plus Cathars' Crusade
I think the deck already has read the bones and Ambition's cost so I'll add Ancient Craving, Sign in Blood, Night's Whisper and maybe Outpost Siege. Can't get too cute for 10 bucks
Stensia Masquarade probably too
We're just doing a draft after each game and you make a 1 for 1 swap, no money limit on the cards
I bought outpost siege was already in it
Matt, I know you don't like them usually, but [[Minions' Murmurs]] will gain you a shitton of card advantage in a lifegain deck.

text: Oh I like that one
Hm
I do like minions.
I liked Damnable Pact a lot in Drana, but it's targeted so I could use it for draw early or just as a kill spell late when I had mana doublers out, etc.
Won't really work in Edger like that. I'm not even running Mana Echoes
Yea, I think that was the only spell of that type I was planning on keeping for that reason

I don't want to rehash the Mathas discussion but based on listening to you and your podcast, I gather folks in your meta have an almost pathological aversion to anything that helps folks, and you gin up this perspective as "we can do math and others can't so they're dumb"; however, that misses that it adds a bit of casual fun to the mix and can help move games along. It can also help those stuck on mana, draw, etc. From a more competitive perspective Mathas is bad, but from a fun standpoint he adds value to the game.
Yeah, Murmurs was in my PLC article
Oh and both times I saw Teferi's Protection cast it was game changing. Not that anyone thought it would be bad or anything.

<@U3L7A68JC> We were talking about it last night and someone commented that the problem with hugs in our meta is that everyone is arrogant regarding their deck construction, so it makes every single person take the attitude that you're helping the worse decks out and doing little for me since I don't need it.
For example, a couple weeks ago I wound up in a 4 person game with 3 12-year-olds and something like Mathas would have been great fun.

It also depends on your take on fun. Fun for me is seeing a well oiled deck do well. There's nothing fun about seeing someone reward for poor deck construction by getting to win game due to a third party Howling Mine.
That's a whole different deal, though. Playing with kids, etc. is a different mindset. I see your point though.
Have you ever appeared on the Brothers War podcast?
But not everyone is a great deck builder or just learning...should they be punished by your superior skills?
BOOTSTRAPS MOTHERFUCKER, PULL THEM
No, I see what you're saying
Down that path is the Dark Side where spikes say "i won't power down my deck, they should build it better!"
Honestly Mathas isn't a great card or effect, it would be better if the effect was closer to the curses where the killer and you got the benefit, but this way is more casually fun.
To more casual players I'll add.
Hey, cool, <@U3M60281W> is on custom magic. Are you a mod there?
Hey there! I'm not a mod there, but I might be able to help. What's up?
<@U3QMCLQQG> I'm trying to convince my son to build a custom set for the big spring project each student has to complete at his school.
It's also wierd because we're really not a spikey meta. Most games last 45 min minimum. Nobody runs Crypt, nobody plays Paradox Engine, etc. But people are absolutely against hugs help.
<@U4V5EHQ2G>, I've noticed that close metas tend to converge on their attitudes.
No, not looking for help, just saw that you got a shout out in the most recent custom magic post in the main sub.
We do have 30+ people playing at the shop most nights, but for sure there tends to be a syncronization-of-menstral-cycles-like effect regarding meta attitudes.
Henry, that's a *huge* undertaking.
Do you guys have MSE?
It is, but it wouldn't be a complete set - possibly enough for small decks so you could actually play a game.
It's a huge undertaking if you do it right. You can always adopt the early Magic model of just throwing a bunch of cards together with no regard to color pie, synergy or logic :slightly_smiling_face:
I have the software.
Yeah, fortunately he can start now - it doesn't all have to be done in the spring.
We had a thought of doing an underground world.
Yeah, part of his presentation would be an explanation of the color pie, how it affects card construction, etc. he listens to MaRo in the car as we drive to school.
Kolbolds!
Sure. Orcs, Elementals, Wurms, etc.
I'll have him make a legendary Kolbold for you <@U33EGB4TX>
It'll have eminence of giving all other creatures the type Kolbold in addition to its other types.
Make it happen, Henry
:stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
Do it.
Pack it full of group hug cards so we can force Dana to have fun.
Ramp spells like "Kolbold Love Fest" where each player searches up x basic lands where x is half the number of Kolbolds in play.
Also, you know that you can export MSE custom cards to Cockatrice and play test them there?
And puts them onto the battlefield.
I didn't but that's cool!
Yup
Oh, folks probably know already but the framing for [[Treasure Cove]] was originally designed for the masterpieces in xln

This week's Magic Story podcast talks about Ixalan, setting the stage.
We'll only see Jace from the Gatewatch, but he has lost his memory (again).
At its core Ixalan is a race between the races to recover a powerful artifact or something called The Immortal Sun kept in the lost Golden City.

PLOT TWIST! It's really the Immortal SON and it's Bolas' egg! He shows up to retrieve it, beats Jace again and sends him scampering off to Dominaria where we'll pick up his story in March. He'll have forgotten his memories again and this time will have stripped down to a blue version of the swim thong from Borat.
Jace, Panty Buncher
Anyone else feel like [[Balan, Wandering Knight]] is flying under the radar?
